name: Bogdan Dit
content: Bogdan Dit - Computer Science Skip to main content Bogdan Dit, Ph.D. Clinical Associate Professor Visit Bogdan Dit’s website CCP 245 Call: (208) 426-5766 bogdandit@boisestate.edu Visit Bogdan Dit’s website Meet Bogdan Bio Education Research Bio Bogdan Dit is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at Boise State University. He received his Ph.D. from The College of William and Mary, where he was advised by Dr. Denys Poshyvanyk. He was a member of the SEMERU Research Group. He obtained his M.S. in Computer Science from Wayne State University, under the supervision of Dr. Andrian Marcus and a B.S. in Computer Science from Babeș-Bolyai University (Cluj-Napoca, Romania). Education Ph.D. from The College of William and Mary M.S. in Computer Science from Wayne State University B.S. in Computer Science from Babeș-Bolyai University (Cluj-Napoca, Romania) Research His current research interests include software engineering, software evolution and maintenance, program comprehension, feature location, software repository mining, application of information retrieval in software engineering, and reproducibility of experiments in software maintenance.
